snippet: The Consumer Product Safety Commission wanted to enforce regulatory rules aimed at high-power magnets in toys after a child died from swallowing one.
abstract: Federal appeals court temporarily halts implementation of Consumer Product Safety Commission's new regulations for high-power magnets, reprieve for manufacturer of Zen Magnets, who marketed product as adult desktop toy Buckyballs.
lead_paragraph: The Consumer Product Safety Commission wanted to enforce regulatory rules aimed at high-power magnets in toys after a child died from swallowing one.

headline.main: High-Power Magnets Get Temporary Reprieve From Safety Rules
headline.print_headline: Court Grants a Temporary Reprieve for High-Power Magnet Safety Regulations
